Edited by Jennifer E. Neal for compliance with DACS and ACM Required Elements for Archival Description
New York University Archives
Isaac Allen Papers
Allen, Isaac
MC 221
1 Linear Feet in one flat box
1922-1930 1922-1927 Isaac Allen attended courses related to architecture at New York Unieversity (NYU) in the early to mid-twentieth century. Materails include four textbooks related to architecture and architectural drawing. Materials primarily in English, with two publications in French. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown. The accession number related to this collection is 10.036.
Arrangement
Materials are arranged by size.
Biographical Note
Isaac Allen attended courses related to architecture at New York Unieversity (NYU) in the early to mid-twentieth century.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Isaac Allen Papers; MC 221; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
Processing decisions made prior to January 2019 were not recorded. In January 2019 the materials were rehoused and stabalized in a 15" x 11" flat box.
Scope and Contents
Materails include four textbooks related to architecture and architectural drawing that were used by Isaac Allen while studying architecture at New York University (NYU) in the early to mid-twentieth century. Allen inscribed his name in a few of the books.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
